Sequence Information.Peptide Name: L-amino-acid oxidase (LAAO, LAO; BpirLAAO-I; reptilia, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family (FIG1 subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli, Pseudomonas aeruginosa. Leishmania sp..
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids, thus producing hydrogen peroxide that may contribute to the diverse toxic effects of this enzyme. This protein may also have activities in hemorrhage, hemolysis, and apoptosis.
Sequence Information.Miscellaneous: Has parasiticidal activities against leishmania, as a result of enzyme-catalyzed hydrogen peroxide production.

Literature.Title: Biochemical and functional characterization of an L-amino acid oxidase isolated from Bothrops pirajai snake venom.
Literature.Author: Izidoro LF, Ribeiro MC, Souza GR, Sant'Ana CD, Hamaguchi A, Homsi-Brandeburgo MI, Goulart LR, Beleboni RO, Nomizo A, Sampaio SV, Soares AM, Rodrigues VM.
